clinical_study.brief_title: Hospice Quality Score Assessment Post Pharmacist Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Impact of Pharmacist Interventions on Hospice Quality Scores

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to investigate the impact of pharmacist delivered interventions on hospice patients quality metric scores.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this study is evaluate a program at a hospice involving activities designed to improve the site's National Quality Forum (NQF) and Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems (HCAHPS) scores. These scores are calculated by the hospice using existing patient satisfaction survey scores (HCAHPS). The institution quantifies their compliance with national quality metrics (NQF) and reports this existing data to the pharmacist providing counseling services to their patients. The pharmacist assesses for areas for improvement and provides additional counseling services to improve the continuity and quality of care. The pilot program is scheduled to launch April 2020 and the researchers will look to assess for changes in the NQF scores, HCAHPS scores, and time for their partnering pharmacy to refill the first set of prescriptions.

primary_outcome.description: Performance metric used by hospice. Scale 0 - 100 (0=min; 100-high)

primary_outcome.measure: Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems

primary_outcome.description: Time to refill prescription from hospice organization (0=min; 100-high)

arm_group.description: Patients that receive pharmacist-delivered services in the pilot program
Patients that do not receive pharmacist-delivered services in the pilot program

intervention.description: Implementation of a medication safety review using a clinical decision support system

study_pop.textblock: Study population will be hospice population who received services for 6-months (e.g., between April 2020 to October 2020) and information including: age (excluding patients 89 years or older), gender, medication risk score, NQF score, HCAHPS score, time to fill medication order set, type of chronic condition, and number of medications will be studied.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Adult patients who were referred to hospice by a healthcare provider
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients 89 years or older
